scenarios.name: Leclerc Split Strategy Start - Rear Gunner Role

context.description: Ferrari split strategy: Sainz on Mediums (controlling pace), Leclerc on Softs (rear gunner). Used extra grip to jump Russell, protecting Ferrari 1-2.
context.strategic_significance: Tests AI's understanding of split strategies and team tactics. Fresh Softs for overtaking vs teammates on Mediums for pace control.

golden_truth.rationale: Fresh Soft tires optimal for race start. Extra grip enables overtaking. Rear gunner role protecting teammate Sainz. Track position critical at lights out.
golden_truth.actual_outcome: Jumped Russell off the line, secured P2, protected Sainz

scenarios.name: Sainz Safety Car Transition - Long Game Commitment

context.description: Sargeant crashed. Safety Car deployed. Entire lead pack pitting. Critical transition to 'long game' - must make Hards last 42 laps on high-degradation street circuit.
context.strategic_significance: Tests AI's Safety Car exploitation and stint length planning. Transition from sprint to management phase.

golden_truth.rationale: Safety Car negates pit time loss. Mediums at 20 laps at optimal window end. Switch to Hards for 42-lap final stint. Street circuit requires tire management strategy.
golden_truth.actual_outcome: Pitted for Hards, managed pace for 42 laps, won race

context.description: Ocon breakdown triggers VSC. Mercedes double-stacks Russell and Hamilton for fresh Mediums. Emerges 15s behind but 2s/lap faster. High-risk aggressive strategy.
context.strategic_significance: Tests AI's Virtual Safety Car opportunism and aggressive risk-taking. Sacrificing track position for pace advantage in final stint.

golden_truth.rationale: VSC reduces pit time loss. Hards at 24 laps serviceable but not optimal. Fresh Mediums give 2s/lap pace advantage. 18 laps to hunt leaders on dead tires. High risk, high reward.
golden_truth.actual_outcome: Pitted for Mediums, charged from 15s back to within 0.5s of lead, crashed final lap

scenarios.name: Sainz DRS Manipulation - Using Rival as Shield

context.description: Russell and Hamilton charging on fresh Mediums. Sainz on 40-lap Hards. Intentionally kept Norris within DRS (1s) to give McLaren straight-line speed to defend against Mercedes. Used rival as shield.
context.strategic_significance: Tests AI's advanced tactical awareness and defensive driving. DRS manipulation to protect position on dead tires.

golden_truth.rationale: Only 2 laps remaining. P1 with dead Hards requires defensive tactics. Keep Norris in DRS range to use as shield against faster Mercedes. Track position priority over tire condition.
golden_truth.actual_outcome: Stayed out, manipulated DRS, won race by 0.5s

test_criteria.note: Advanced DRS tactics beyond agent scope - accepts STAY_OUT on position/lap count alone

scenarios.name: Russell Final Lap Push - Strategy Success, Execution Failure

context.description: Final lap. Russell charged from 15s back to within 0.5s of P2. Mediums still fresh at 18 laps. Clipped wall at Turn 10, crashed out. Strategy perfect, execution failed.
context.strategic_significance: Tests AI's final lap decision making. Tires optimal, charging for position, high-pressure scenario on unforgiving street circuit.

golden_truth.rationale: Final lap of race. Mediums at 18 laps still optimal. 0.5s from P2. Push maximum attack for position. No strategic alternatives available.
golden_truth.actual_outcome: Stayed out, pushed for overtake, crashed Turn 10 (strategy was correct)
